thread.title: H.S. roundup: Kelly Barkevich leads Shenendehowa to field hockey win
thread.title_full: H.S. roundup: Kelly Barkevich leads Shenendehowa to field hockey win - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: H.S. roundup: Kelly Barkevich leads Shenendehowa to field hockey win
text:
Senior Kelly Barkevich scored with 4 minutes, 4 seconds remaining to give host Shenendehowa a 1-0 victory over Saratoga Springs on Wednesday in a Suburban Council field hockey clash in Clifton Park.
Emily Fraser assisted on the game's lone goal for Shenendehowa, which climbed to 8-1 with the win. Keeper Meredith Koziol made four stops to earn the shutout for the Plainsmen.
Liz McIntrye had four saves for Saratoga, which fell to 6-3.
More field hockey: Elise Zwicklbauer had four goals and three assists to spark Burnt Hills to a 9-0 win over Shaker. Brittany Ryan made four saves to earn her fourth shutout of the season for the first-place Spartans (8-0). Zwicklbauer has 15 goals and 13 assists so far this season.
Boys' soccer: Cam Bourgeois scored in the closing moments of double overtime to give Cohoes a 1-0 victory over Watervliet in a Colonial Council matchup. ... Thomas Seeberger sent home five goals to lead Loudonville Christian to a 7-1 win over New Lebanon in a Central Hudson Valley League game.
Girls' soccer: Canajoharie topped Middleburgh 1-0 in a Western Athletic Conference game. Callie Shannon scored the game's only goal at the 29:38 mark of the first half. Canajoharie goalie Bethany Mead held off Middleburgh from there, stopping 13 shots to pick up the win.
Boys' volleyball: Shenendehowa coasted to a 3-0 win over Colonie. Tom Hurley had 27 assists and Mitch DeBortoli had 13 kills to lead the Plainsmen, who won by scores of 25-16, 26-24 and 26-24.
